page.title: 01Kidlington and Hampton Doyle
page.content: The blocks rural aspect isbeing eroded by sprawling Kidlington. (pop 14500) The early stone built village near the church (slide 2) is now an appendage to the development along the ribbon of the busy A423T. Approx 4,500 houses exist,mainly brick,and are still being built. They house workers, mainly at Austin Rover. Most are owner occupied,the crime rate is low. Though communal activities include sport/recreational/educationl/entertai nment- geographical and social focus is lacking. Thames Valley Police Authority is housed here. River Cherwell flows NW - SE dividding the block. On its flood plain (Hampton Poyle) pop 115 is less developed,housing 19 traditional stone ouses and 18 brick/rendered .Farm workers live in tied cottages,most dwellrs are school/university teachers
